title.rendered: Bangalore vs UP, India Women’s League 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Bangalore: Smriti Mandhana (c), Sophie Devine, Ellyse Perry, Heather Knight, Richa Ghosh (wk), Poonam Khemnar, Kanika Ahuja, Shreyanka Patil, Megan Schutt, Renuka Thakur Singh, Preeti Bose

In the last game, UP took a bold call to drop the in-form Grace Haris to accommodate Shabnim Ismail considering conditions and overall team combination.

UP: Alyssa Healy (c & wk), Shweta Sehrawat, Kiran Navgire, Tahlia McGrath, Deepti Sharma, Simran Shaikh, Devika Vaidya, Sophie Ecclestone, Shabnim Ismail/Grace Haris, Anjali Sarvani, Rajeshwari Gayakwad

Pitch Report

Venue: Brabourne Stadium, Mumbai

(Based on the last three games)

1st innings average score: 193

2nd innings average score: 191

Wickets per innings: 6

Type: Good for batting

Wins

Batting 1st: 67%

Batting 2nd: 33%

Fantasy Tips of The Day

Richa Ghosh is the only player from Bangalore to star in the Best11 in all three outings. Coincidentally, all these games were played at the Brabourne Stadium.

There, however, is a bigger star featuring in this contest. Sophie Ecclestone made it to the Best11 in eight consecutive matches, overall managing 17 wickets and registering a top score of 22* in a tough run chase.

Smriti Mandhana is the leading run-getter at the venue. Her 305 runs have come at an average 32 and a strike rate of 147.

Heather Knight has been a delightful pick in fantasy leagues. She has generated 30-run bonus twice and has picked four wickets in a mere three games – all at the Brabourne Stadium.

The top score of the tournament belongs to Tahlia McGrath, who smacked 90* off 50 against Delhi last week. For that matter, her recent form has been outstanding, scoring three fifties in the last six innings.

The Brabourne Stadium has been a good hunting ground for Ellyse Perry. In nine innings, she has scored two fifties and three thirties, and scalped four wickets.

In her last eight T20s, Shreyanka Patil has gone wicketless only once, overall managing 12 wickets. She can also provide handy runs down the order.

Alyssa Healy has been in stunning form of late, scoring below 20 runs only twice in the last 10 games. During this period, she averaged 45.

Deepti Sharma’s recent numbers have dipped a bit, but the fact that she averages 46 with the bat and has taken nine wickets in six games at the venue must boost her confidence.
